data.title: d2k aircraft speeds are far too slow.
data.body: I suspect the values defined in the original d2k were before the acceleration bonuses were applied.  As they are in OpenRA it feels like carryalls are actually slower than letting harvesters drive themselves, and the starport deliveries slow to the point that I first though somebody had broken the production traits.

data.title: Weird visual 'drop' when vehicles exit factory in TS
data.body: Only noticable in isometric perspective. They suddenly 'drop' by a few pixels when they move past a certain point after exiting the factory. Applies to voxel and sprite actors alike, so probably not just a visual issue.

data.title: Add 'Flip/Mirror' functionality for sequences
data.body:
Some older 2D games (Dune 2, MechCommander 1, AoE to give some examples) only had art for part of the facings 'clock', and then flipped/mirrored them to cover the rest.

This could also save modders some work if they make custom graphics that don't have a 'bias' towards left or right (muzzle flashes with facings, units in a 100% top-down perspective or with the 'light source' placed in the middle etc.).

Preferrably, this should be customisable per sub-sequence when combining aggregate sequences.

data.title: Tweaked D2k warhead falloffs
data.body:
I recently played the original quite a bit and I think our area of effect on several weapons is over the top even compared to the original, which is one of the reasons why debris are too powerful on bleed (they are being dealt with in #9615).

I tried to keep things as simple and consistent as possible, but this might need more testing and fine-tuning.

data.title: Fix a series of visibility/targeting bugs
data.body:
The commit messages say it all.
Fixes #9667 - spies were totally broken.
Fixes #9157 - basically nobody cared about invisibility on structures.

P.S.: Also fixes #9351.
P.P.S.: Also fixes #2959.
And let's say it fixes #9470.

data.title: d2k: smoking chimneys on refineries don't work anymore
data.body:
Probably a bug in the fragment shader, introduced with 83949b250a07b8829b5e3b3bb2ad95644c7fec17 in #9476.

Removing [these two lines](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/glsl/shp.frag#L16-L17) makes it work again, but that's most likely not the correct solution.

data.title: Don't try to return fire if invisible and the attacker is out of reach
data.body:
Firing with a V2 rocket launcher near a camo pillbox makes the pillbox try to return fire.
That means it uncloaks to shoot. But the V2 is outside it's weapon's radius, so it can't attack it.
Result is the camo pillbox sits there uncloaked until the target is destroyed or until ordered to Stop.

I suppose the same thing will apply to air attackers and perhaps to stealth defenses in TS.

If the actor cannot return fire, it shouldn't uncloak at all. (In this case I wasn't even targeting the pillbox, I was shooting at the ground 2 cells away from it.)
## <bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add soviet-06b
data.body:
This adds the mission soviet-06b.

**Changes compared to the original:**
- Removed soviet tech center as it doesn't provide the player with unlocks (flamethrower)
- Open path to gems near enemy base

**Known issues:**
- Name is too long for the mission browser (Shorten the name or rework the browser to support it?)

**Suggestions for difficulty settings are more than welcome.**

data.title: Helicopters can be repulsed off the edge of the map.
data.body:
Make a bunch of helicopters, then start making a line of them from the edge of the map. Eventually the latest heli the enter the line will push the first one out of the playable area. Continue doing this and you can push several helis off the map and then sneak behind enemy defenses and such with them.
